Articles.Content:
So for reasons unbeknownst to me, I decided to launch a command ship decked out with science apertures and huge fuel tanks for supporting small landers on science missions for the (awesome) career mode.

The problem is, I've stuck my final stage for it (orbital) on the nose in the construction section. Balanced weight nicely by hanging large detachable tanks down the side and leaving my living quarters on the inside but now that I've refuelled it and attached landers and other modules, I've realised that the navball thinks the thruster faces forward. Is there any way I can flip that ball 180' so I don't have to go right back to the drawing board?

I did have a search but couldn't quite figure out what to look for... :s
Right-click on a bit of your ship that points in the desired direction of travel (docking ring, command pod, etc) and select "Control from here".
